verse:
सर्वे वेदा यत्पदमामनन्ति तपांसि सर्वाणि च यद्वदन्ति।
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण ब्रवीम्योमित्येतत्‌ ॥

terms.सर्वे वेदा यत्पदमामनन्ति: All the Vedas contemplate upon that highest state,
terms.तपांसि सर्वाणि च यद्वदन्ति: All the austerities and disciplines speak of that truth,
terms.यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति: Those who desire to attain it lead a life of celibacy,
terms.तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण ब्रवीम्योमित्येतत्: I will explain that state to you in brief, O Maitreya, listen to this.

meaning: Meaning: This verse emphasizes that all the Vedas, austerities, and disciplines are focused on attaining the highest state or the ultimate truth. The verse suggests that leading a life of celibacy, or brahmacharya, is a means to attain this highest state. The speaker, possibly Sage Maitreya, promises to explain this truth concisely.

upanishad-org.meaning: The seat or goal that all the Vedas glorify and which austerities declare, for the desire of which men practise holy living, of That will I tell thee in brief compass. OM is that goal, O Nachiketas.
